context.p: When you manage multiple projects, some projects have similar settings and/or the same structure. You can create a template project, in which you set up the folder structure, roles, forms and workflows, and use this template for each new project you create.
You can create a new project based on an existing project:

step.cmd: Log into Bricsys 24/7 on the login page.
Select a project in the content pane.

ul.li: country in which the project will be carried out

step.stepresult:
The Copy project - Step 2 window appears.
Copy project - Step 2

step.cmd: Select and/or deselect the options you want to copy to your new project.

step.stepresult: A pop up window informs you that @@@ reported a bug in the new interface.

postreq.note: When you copy a project, the folder structure is copied, but the documents are not transferred. If you need a copy of the folders with documents included, you must select the folders and documents manually, and use the copy action. It is also possible to copy the documents with the Bricsys 24/7 Transfer Tool.

You can copy the forms and metadata together with the project. However, as the documents are not transferred automatically, the form records will not be transferred either. This does not apply to the links between forms and folders.
Example: When you copy a project, and select Forms and Metadata, the links between forms and folders will be copied. As a consequence, if you upload a new document in a folder with a form attached, you will be asked to enter the metadata.
